conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: elevated angled view with wall height/thickness, visible floor plane, volumetric rooms, and roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable corners and room volumes; isometric-like angle with limited distortion; cutaway is clean with minor simplification around some wall/door junctions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches the 2D plan (central living/dining, kitchen at left, bedrooms distributed across top/right/bottom, bathrooms clustered on right). Some proportional/partition differences are visible (hallway widths and a few internal wall segments/offsets appear simplified).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (sofas+dining, kitchen run, multiple beds, bathroom fixtures). Placement generally aligns with corresponding rooms; scale is mostly reasonable with slight stylization.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/openings/floors are easy to read; lighting is even and does not hide geometry; materials are consistent with no obvious mesh breakage.

detected_errors.description: Some internal partitions and room proportions appear simplified/shifted compared to the 2D plan (notably portions of the circulation/hall and a few wall offsets).
A few door/window placements and opening proportions are not verifiably identical to the 2D plan (minor alignment/size discrepancies).

summary: This is a valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric modeling and generally faithful layout, with moderate simplification in some internal wall/proportion details and minor opening mismatches.
